div.p: Ag 34/8 Gregory papers, Mitchell Library, State Library of New South Wales, Sydney.

This afternoon your letter has been read to the Committee of the Institute and has finally persuaded them of the impracticability of the route along Capricorn.
Gregory's letter of 25 November 1857 to J. Macadam was read at a meeting of the Exploration Committee on 7 December 1857 (Transactions of the Philosophical Institute of Victoria, vol. 2 (1858), Reports of Committees, pp. xv-xviii). I had remonstrated before with them and embodied my ideas in a paper.
B58.05.03.

Supported by one of the wisest men we have, the hon. Mr Hodgson M.L.C. and formerly Maire
Mayor. of the city, my plan has been adopted, to start from the Darling with a light party and packhorses only, as thus an other searching line for Leichhardt will be drawn, as the country altho' politically belonging to NSW will become of value to Victoria squatters for store-cattle & sheep, and as it will not be a direct and stupid interference with your own contemplated operations.
Augustus Gregory's Leichhardt Search Expedition, 1858. See Cumpston (1972).

Mr Blandowski is rather savage about the alteration. Dr Wilkie Dr M'Adam and myself form the select committee
This subcommittee produced a progress report for the Exploration Committee; B58.14.01.

I sincerely hope that it will fall to your share to explore the country west of the Burdekin and I shall be delighted to report on any plants, which may fall into your hands.
B59.04.03.

I intend to go at the end of the month to examine the plants of Cape Otway.
See M to D. Moore, 17 December 1857.
With my best wishes for your welfare and my greatest respect
